pullRequest.body:
Also extracts `trim_anti_measurableSpace`

---

The scope of this PR is intentionally limited so that the PR is small. I'm going to migrate measures, then add more classes in subsequent PRs.


<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Note that this is now the third time this has been attempted, #8453 and #8375. Both are stale of course, so maybe this one can replace them.
This one and #12684 already pass the CI. I suggest that we merge them, then we can look at the old ones to see if there are parts that are still relevant.

:v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/74658ee2-031b-4832-9940-94144e4dce6a) for commit 3be5923dc0b8e1cd4c7ed304ad9d79d7037f2fe9.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/1c2eeabf-af93-4f26-bd06-cc67f558cb25/to/74658ee2-031b-4832-9940-94144e4dce6a) against commit 26918687403e3a36cc3f2209ad2db0da46295aed:
```diff
  Benchmark                                            Metric         Change
  ==========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Condexp                  instructions    27.1%
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Density   instructions    22.6%
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.MeasureCompProd          instructions    30.6%
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Variance                        instructions    12.9%
```
I'm benchmarking the next PR as well to see if some of these issues go away once we use `FunLike` for measures as well.
@eric-wieser Do you know how to figure out which theorems became slower?
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c75b02d9-1eb5-4794-a20c-140cb5ed0f7d) for commit 396ab12f574698843c53c17ade895a7547da7782.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a4b6f751-27f7-4b04-a5d8-6688a5dbbd67/to/c75b02d9-1eb5-4794-a20c-140cb5ed0f7d) against commit 3e7a1952821f97af73616bdb2cfbf833afbb2ee1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                            Metric         Change
  ==========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Condexp                  instructions   -76.0%
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Density   instructions    22.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.MeasureCompProd          instructions   -89.6%
- ~Mathlib.Probability.Variance                        instructions    12.9%
```
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8963713989/job/24614382587)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8963713989/job/24614382684)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8963713989/job/24614382336)

bors d+

Let's make the scope of the `erw` a little more fine-grained, otherwise this looks fine to go in.

bors d+

Let's make the scope of the `erw` a little more fine-grained, otherwise this looks fine to go in.
I think #12686 will make this `erw` unnecessary
If only one of these needs an `erw`, can you separate it into a `rw` and an `erw`? Same on the previous one.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: use `FunLike` for `OuterMeasure`
